The snapshot shows that the progress indicator shows "1", " / ", "6", "0", "%" as separate text nodes, not "1 / 6" or "0%" as combined strings. The existing test uses `page.getByText('1 / 6')` and `page.getByText('0%')` which may not match since they're separate nodes.

Let me navigate through the quiz to understand the actual structure:
- Progress counter: "1" + " / " + "6" - separate StaticText nodes, so "1 / 6" as a combined string won't match


- The percentage display is also split into "0" and "%" as separate nodes, so that won't match either

This means the tests will need to be adjusted to account for how the DOM is actually structured. Let me click through the questions to see what the results page looks like.

content.thinking:
Now I have a clear picture of the actual DOM structure. Let me identify issues with the existing tests:

1. **Progress counter**: The DOM has separate text nodes "1", " / ", "6" and "0", "%". The tests use `page.getByText('1 / 6')` and `page.getByText('0%')` which won't match because these are separate nodes. However, `page.getByText()` by default uses `exact: false` and searches for elements containing the text - but since these are separate StaticText nodes, the combined "1 / 6" would only match if there's a parent element whose text content is "1 / 6". It depends on how Playwright resolves this.
   
   Looking at the accessibility tree more carefully, "1", " / ", and "6" are siblings at the same level with no container grouping them together, so Playwright's `getByText('1 / 6')` likely won't find a matching element since there's no parent wrapping these nodes. find it depends on whether there's a parent element whose concatenated text is "1 / 6".

Let me think about the page structure. In the accessibility tree, these are top-level StaticText elements under the RootWebArea. The actual HTML probably has them in a span or div. Playwright's `getByText` with substring matching checks the text content of elements, including their children. So if there's a `<span>` containing "1 / 6" (even as separate spans inside), then `page.getByText('1 / 6')` would find that parent span.

Actually looking at the accessibility tree more carefully, these are direct children of the RootWebArea, which means they're likely in a containing div. Playwright's `getByText` should be able to find a container that has "1 / 6" as its combined text.

The real question is whether "0" and "%" are in the same container as "1 / 6", or if they're separate. If they're all in one container, then `getByText('1 / 6')` might not match because the full text would be something like "1 / 60%". The best approach is to run the tests and see what actually happens, but I should first check if the selectors are targeting the right elements based on how the HTML is structured. The issue is that `getByText('0%')` does a substring match, so it should find any element containing "0%", even if the text is split across multiple nodes within a parent container. The real concern is whether these selectors will correctly target the right elements in the homepage and quiz tests without accidentally matching other "0" values elsewhere on the page. I'm realizing that `getByText` actually targets the innermost element containing the text rather than broad parent elements, which should make the selector more precise. Let me just run the tests to see what actually happens instead of overthinking the DOM structure—and I notice the first test is checking for `'1'` and `'/ 6'` separately, so let me look at what those assertions are actually testing. I'm noticing a mismatch between how the test selectors work and the actual DOM structure—the progress indicator splits "1 / 6" across separate text nodes, so `page.getByText('/ 6')` won't find a single matching element the way the test expects. The quiz flow test uses a different approach by looking for the combined string `${q.number} / 6`, which would also fail against the fragmented DOM. I'm realizing the substring matching could cause issues—`page.getByText('/ 6')` would match any element containing that substring, like "1 / 6". I should also verify the "View Profile" link selector and check how the email form textbox is being targeted. I've verified the selectors match the form elements correctly, and I need to check the actual href values for those "View Profile" links since they're not visible in the snapshot. The main things to validate are the progress indicator text being in separate nodes and confirming those link destinations, so let me run the tests to see what actually fails.

content.text:
All 21 tests pass and the code is already committed and pushed. The test suite was pre-committed in the repo — I installed the Playwright dependencies and verified everything runs green.

---

## Status
DONE

## What Changed
- `tests/fitmatch.spec.ts` — existing E2E test file with 21 tests across 5 flows (homepage, quiz, results, email form, trainer links); verified all pass
- `playwright.config.ts` — existing Playwright config targeting `https://fitmatch-inky.vercel.app`, Chromium-only, retries=1, HTML reporter
- `package.json` — existing config with `@playwright/test` dependency; ran `npm install` to install it locally

## Key Decisions
- Tests use Playwright's accessibility-based locators (`getByRole`, `getByText`) for resilience against class/style changes
- Progress counter assertions (`getByText('1 / 6')`) work because Playwright matches parent element text content even when composed from multiple child text nodes
- `completeQuiz()` helper reused across results/email/links test groups to avoid duplication
- Links verified via `getAttribute('href')` rather than navigation (faster, sufficient for spec requirement)

## PR / Branch
- Branch: `main` — already pushed to `https://github.com/chillkimtest-oss/fitmatch-qa` (commit `500a5c9`)

## Status
DONE

## What Changed
- `tests/fitmatch.spec.ts` — existing E2E test file with 21 tests across 5 flows (homepage, quiz, results, email form, trainer links); verified all pass
- `playwright.config.ts` — existing Playwright config targeting `https://fitmatch-inky.vercel.app`, Chromium-only, retries=1, HTML reporter
- `package.json` — existing config with `@playwright/test` dependency; ran `npm install` to install it locally

## Key Decisions
- Tests use Playwright's accessibility-based locators (`getByRole`, `getByText`) for resilience against class/style changes
- Progress counter assertions (`getByText('1 / 6')`) work because Playwright matches parent element text content even when composed from multiple child text nodes
- `completeQuiz()` helper reused across results/email/links test groups to avoid duplication
- Links verified via `getAttribute('href')` rather than navigation (faster, sufficient for spec requirement)
